title: Best Turkey Burgers Recipe
description: This turkey burger recipe is quick to make with easy ingredients for tasty turkey burgers that are full of savory flavors your family will love.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Burger Recipes Turkey Best Turkey Burgers 4.6 (2,635) 1,907 Reviews 132 Photos This turkey burger recipe is the best. After making them the first time my husband said "no more" to beef burgers. These are full of flavor — any cooking method may be used, and they freeze very well. The recipe can also be used for meatballs or meatloaves. Submitted by Trudi Davidoff Updated on February 7, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 132 132 132 132 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 burgers Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Whether you've been searching for the best turkey burger, need to use up the ground turkey lurking in your freezer, or are simply tired of beef burgers, boy, do we have the recipe for you. Gone are the days of boring, dry, and lacking-in-flavor turkey burgers thanks to this 5-star creation. Trust us, this turkey burger recipe has earned over 1,500 5-star reviews and it will certainly be your new go-to recipe. How to Make Turkey Burgers The good news is that making turkey burgers from scratch is quite easy. All you need is ground turkey, onion, bread crumbs, eggs, and some seasonings and you're good to go. Simply combine your ground turkey, diced onion, bread crumbs, egg whites, garlic, parsley, salt, and ground pepper in a bowl. We recommend sticking with ground turkey that's about 93% lean or less — any leaner than that and your burger might fall apart. Form the ground turkey mixture into patties and cook the burgers using your preferred method. How to Cook Turkey Burgers The turkey burgers are cooked in a skillet on the stove in this recipe, but you can also cook turkey burgers on the grill, in the oven, and in the air fryer. Turkey burgers should be cooked until their internal temperature is at least 165 degrees F. Skillet: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook the patties in the skillet, turning once, about 15 minutes.Grill: Lightly oil and preheat the grill. Place turkey burgers on the grill, turning once, about 10 minutes.Oven: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the patties on the baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes.Air fryer: Preheat the air fryer to 360 degrees F and place patties inside. Air fry for about 15 minutes, flipping halfway through. What to Put on a Turkey Burger Just like a beef hamburger, turkey burger toppings are all up to you. You can be as creative or plain as you like. Some common toppings include lettuce, tomato, cheese, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, and pickles. Or you can try something beyond the basic toppings and add jalapeños if you want a kick, guacamole if you want something Mexican-inspired, or an egg if you're going for a breakfast-for-dinner vibe. We'll leave the possibilities up to your imagination. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "These are great! I used seasoned salt instead of regular salt, but other than that followed the recipe. They do freeze well as I made some and froze them for later meals and they came out fine," says missbettyjane. "These burgers were scrumptious! I'd take them any day over regular hamburgers! served them topped with lettuce, red onion, ketchup, and mustard, and they were so flavorful and juicy," raves one community member. "DELICIOUS! I wish I could give this recipe 10 stars!! I followed others' advice and added some Worcestershire sauce/hot sauce and the burgers were amazing! I only cook for 2 but I always make extras and freeze these because they're so good," according to Letis. Editorial contributions by Bailey Fink Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 3 pounds ground turkey ¼ cup seasoned bread crumbs ¼ cup finely diced onion 2 egg whites, lightly beaten ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley 1 clove garlic, peeled and minced 1 teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix ground turkey, seasoned bread crumbs, onion, egg whites, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Form into 12 patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook the patties in a medium skillet over medium heat, turning once, to an internal temperature of 180 degrees F (85 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Editor's Note: This recipe appeared in Allrecipes Magazine and was modified to include ingredients for a spicy mayo and toppings. I Made It Print 3,686 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Best Turkey Burgers 01 of 132 Photo by  Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans 02 of 132 Photo by  lutzflcat 08/26/2024 A storm blew in right around dinner time, so we ended up air frying instead of grilling the burgers. We thought these were pretty good, but we’ll stick with a beefy hamburger over a turkey burger. But admittedly, this breaks down much better nutritionally than using ground beef. I slathered on some Sweet and Spicy Sriracha Aioli (on this site) which was a good complement to the mild ground turkey and really kicked up the flavor. 03 of 132 Photo by  1010lisalynn 08/18/2024 “This Sure Is Good”!While we were enjoying our turkey burgers my husband repeatedly said, “this sure is good”. And I agree this burger recipe is very good.This burger recipe was easy and quite moist which is not that easy using ground turkey.Clarifications, changes and additions I made:- used 1lb of ground turkey- used red onion- used 85% turkey lean ground turkey to ensure moister meat- cooked on a parchment lined baking sheet in the over 360 for 22 minutes till the temperature reached 150- heated “everything” hamburger bun in air fryer at 350 for 5 minutes on toast- added sliced white cheddar on the burger the last 2 minutes in the oven- served with romaine lettuce piece, pickles, a slice of tomato and Trader Joes’s MagnifisauceThe biggest challenge in the recipe was to convert it from 12 servings (patties) to 2 servings (2-3 patties). I tried to do the math, but it was too convoluted for example 2 egg whites for 12 servings to 2 servings. Ultimately, I winged with many years of cooking experience and did 1 egg white and guessed at the rest of ingredients.These turkey burger wonderful!! 04 of 132 Photo by  Linda T 08/15/2024 Good basic burgers. Can add pretty much anything to it for a different flavor profile. I made it as is and served on a homemade hamburger bun ..It was very good. Reheated premade burgers in the air fryer just fine 05 of 132 Photo by  Cheesecake Lady 02/06/2021 06 of 132 Photo by  stephanie 01/27/2021 I made this and it was amazing! I made mine into 8 patties. I used 4 baby bell Gouda cheeses sliced in half to stuff my patties. It was divine! 07 of 132 Photo by  Trevor O. 08/18/2020 DELICIOUS! Added more garlic and bell pepper. Dynamite. 08 of 132 Photo by  Neeraj D'Mello 07/04/2020 09 of 132 Photo by  Sarah McNamara Westgate 06/29/2020 My daughter and I made this for dinner one evening a few weeks ago. It was hit! My husband and oldest daughter weren’t really into trying it, but once they did, they loved it!! We are having them again tomorrow night. 10 of 132 Photo by  Sarah McNamara Westgate 06/29/2020 My daughter and I made this for dinner one evening a few weeks ago. It was hit! My husband and oldest daughter weren’t really into trying it, but once they did, they loved it!! We are having them again tomorrow night. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Blue Cheese Burgers 974 Ratings Garlic and Ranch Turkey Burgers 232 Ratings Asian-Style Turkey Burgers 81 Ratings Grilled Turkey Burgers with Cranberry Horseradish Dressing 26 Ratings Sour Cream Burgers 252 Ratings Beth's Portobello Mushroom Burgers 32 Ratings Mediterranean Lamb Burgers 43 Ratings Healthy Turkey Loaf 509 Ratings Mushroom Blue Cheese Turkey Burgers 342 Ratings Pizza Burgers II 13 Ratings Spinach and Feta Turkey Burgers 857 Ratings Curry Turkey Burgers 2 Ratings Seasoned Turkey Burgers 684 Ratings Chef John's Turkey Burger 77 Ratings Turkey Patties 42 Ratings Spicy Black Bean and Corn Burgers 66 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
